intro: Halogeton alopecuroides var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth halogeton, is a species of flowering plant in the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia, where it thrives in saline and alkaline soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ability to store water, it is often found in desert environments and is considered an important component of desert flora.
